text:
11 December 1961
Dear Sam,
Upon returning to Houston and reading my letter to you
of December 7, which was mailed In my absence, I notice
that a word or two was left out of my second paragraph*
T betd intended to convey the feeling that I do in principle
agree with the idea of a MAER-Senctioned Audience Survey
Research organization* There are, however, obvious problems
that srch an organization would have to solve to Justify
itself In the sense that It could do a job that is not only
more ethical but is methodologically sounder than the exist¬
ing commercial survey organizations*
I was much interested in the comments of the other members
of the research committee* T think that in the case of
t/ilbur and Hideya, some real but, in my opinion, not in¬
surmountable obstacles were articulated*
Cordially yours.
Richard I* Evans
Professor of Psychology
Dr* Samuel L. Decker, Chairman
UAHB Research Committee
Department of Speech and Dramatic Art
Television-Radio-Film
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
